subject: G-Men Rule
event:
Life is magical and full of joy!

The Gints opened their 2010 season by kicking some Panther ass, and I got up at three in the morning (Aussie time) to watch it all on Parris's latop, courtesy of DirecTV and NFL Season Ticket.

(I will NOT be be able to do the same with tonight's Jets game, so no talk about that here).

Not a perfect or dominating performance by any means but a convincing victory all the same.  The G-Men looked especially good in the second half when their running game finally started to generate some yards.  The defense bent a lot in the first half, allowing Carolina to drive deep, but never broke, holding the Panthers to field goals instead of touchdowns.  In the second half the D really started to look good.

Sill, a lot of areas to work on.  The special teams looked awful.  This new punter is no Jeff Feagles, and unless he improves, that could be a real problem.   And the WRs dropped way too many balls, letting them bounce off their hands to Panther defenders.  None of the Giant INTs were actaully Eli's fault... unlike the Panther INTs, which were all due to bad decisions by their QB.

But hey, it's  win.  I'll take it.

The first of many Big Blue victories at the new stadium, I hope.

And I had a great signing at Galaxy in Sydney as well.

comments.article:
(I will NOT be be able to do the same with tonight's Jets game, so no talk about that here).

If that's because of access and not timing, try ustream.tv

(I'm pretty happy, myself: nice to start the season with an away win over Buffalo plus we limited them to only 166 yards!)
I'm glad you were able to watch the game.  I was wondering about that.  My team ('49ers) got pantsed by Seattle.

I've been waiting for those Seahawks to show up for three years now.  LOTS of strange plays this week.  I actually have to feel sorry for the Lions.  That was a freaking TD at the end!  The Chiefs looked vastly improved tonight, and could be a factor in the AFC West if they ever throw downfield.  Of course, Rivers had an off night, the Charger receivers had stone hands and they were horrific on punt coverage.
hey heres to your giants and my skins the only nfc east teams to win this week

Glad that you could see it live and in color. I hope. As always I look forward to your comments on the NFL.

Looked like the wheel needed greasing. Yes, the punting game looks scary bad. Special teams play needs consistency as does the pass rush. It does look like the Gints improved from last season. Fingers crossed, wood knocked for a healthy season.

The Jets got themselves into a bit of off field comess with some hottie... Is it wrong for me to say hottie? Oh well. Don't flame me, bro. It was unprofessional, inappropriate and wrong for them to behave in a sexist manner towards that reporter. Regardless of how she was dressed. When will these adolescents in men's bodies learn that there is a difference between appreciating a woman's sexiness and being an ass. Anyhow, I hope they aren't distracted by their own nonsense.

I was super impressed with the Giants D. Apart from the last-second TD in the first half (which was really set up by poor Special Teams play), they were solid and made tons of plays.

Offense was great once they got in a groove as well. Looking good for the G-Men, especially after the Cowboys lost (wow what a game that was!)

I watched the whole game here in Southern California (why that was the Fox game we got, I have no idea), and I have to say, you've got to cut that punter some slack. For example, that safety totally wasn't his fault. I don't know what the line was doing, but those two defenders shouldn't have been in front of his kicking foot that early. And besides, the kid's a rookie! The Giants have to build his confidence or look for a new punter.

Yeah, that was really weird. I spent 3 hours flipping between Giants/Panthers and Jags/Broncos. I mean, I was happy because it was football, but still!

Very pleased with the Patriots' performance, looking forward to a good season!
I'm always happy to see the Panthers lose, so ... go Giants!
I'm a Lions fan.  Someone has it in for Detroit sports.  There is no other explanation.

Off subject - not a football fan doesn't even begin to cover it - but I didn't know if you were aware of the promo package for I&F that was aired about 5 minutes prior to the True Blood season finale.  It was about two to three minutes long, and was a great look at the upcoming show.  Just please tell me they didn't process out all of the color to make everything grey and blah in editing.
I've always thought Eli doesn't receive enough credit.  People talk about him as though he's never won a Superbowl or anything.
Ask around wherever you're staying.  I'm able to get Monday Night Football on cable in Thailand--not a lot of other live sports on Tuesday mornings. :)

Nobody in the media pays attention to the offensive line because it’s not sexy.  Big mouth wide receivers, running backs with sprinter speed, quarterbacks with movie star looks are the things the media is interested in.  But look at Sunday.  The Texans beat the defending AFC champions convincingly and the Cowboys lost to a mediocre Redskins team.   Why?   Because the Texans’ offensive line dominated and the Cowboys’ couldn’t.  It’s all about the offensive line.  The great coaches know that while idiots like Jerry Jones are just looking for the next sexy wide receiver.
comments.subject: A mixed bag down here in Tejas

comments.article:
Here you go George-They are looking really spiffy at this link to Live For Films. Off topic for this particular post, but oh well. http://tiny.cc/phyzr.
I watched the Redskins beat the Dallas Cowboys-mwhahaha-and yes, the Cowboys couldve/shouldve won that game on the last play-but they didn't-mwhahaha.
I'm behind on True Blood-so i imagine they played these promoes before or after.
Short answer, GOT is looking really, really good.
comments.subject: Game Of thrones Promoes

comments.article:
Giants win, Eagles almost win and Vick looked good, Redskins win, and I am one bitter bitter Cowboys fan.

Im almost finished with Game Of Thrones. I am loving it, I got my dad into it as well and he has been loving it.

All will be well when Dallas gets their head on straight and whips the Gnats.
comments.subject: What a bad day.

comments.article:
My Colts had a poor showing, but here's hoping they rebound against your G-Men in a big way.

The big talk of yesterday was that awful no TD call against the Lions. They can never catch a break in Detroit.

Can't say I'm not a little stoked to see Peyton and Eli go head-to-head again. And yeah, that call was a totally BS. The rules need to be rewritten regarding that. Lions fans get a weeks worth of sympathy. Then I'll return to heckling them.

As a Michigander, none are more familiar with hopelessness than we Lions fans . . . but I am standing firm behind my view that, despite the call which dictated our first loss this year being in accordance to the "letter of the law," we were robbed of our first road victory in 20 games. Calvin Johnson made that catch, and any with a good eye and a lick of common sense could see that (including the official, who immediately raised his hands to signal touchdown). I don't fault the Chicago fans/players for accepting the win, of course; they aren't the ones who word the rules in such a pathetic fashion, so as to include the "process" of the catch, which essentially makes an incomplete pass out of one that was so obviously completed with control. However, that hardly means that I'm not bitter!

Anyhow, Mr. Martin, I'm pleased to see that your Giants won their game. Of your two New York teams, those in blue are the ones I can stand behind.

Admittedly, I don't much appreciate their green-blooded counterparts.

Safe journeys, good sir!
Go Hawks! Hasselbeck's still got it. Look out Denver!

Thank you so much for coming to the signing at Galaxy Books (can't believe I'm the first to mention it here in the comments).

It was a real treasure to meet you and shake your hand. I sent the picture to my brother stateside, and he was incredibly jealous!

I'm building a house right now so all my books are in boxes, but right after the signing I pull out the audio books and have started with The Hedge Knight once more.

And Mo Ryan put together a nice little article, including the new Videos, the previous Video, a link to a new production diary on HBO and a copy of a recent note from Benioff and Weiss to the fans:

http://www.tvsquad.com/2010/09/12/Game-of-Thrones/
comments.subject: Congrats on the Giants!

comments.article:
Also very happy to meet you at Galaxy yesterday.

I would have loved to make it down to Melbourne for Worldcon and have time for a decent conversation, but a brief encounter at the signing was a very enjoyable alternative.

My friends and I got to the store before it opened (overestimating the zeal of the other fans) and had a very pleasant morning sitting on the floor of the bookshop, analyzing the new HBO promo scene by scene and chatting about our favorite series.

http://www.cannonade.net/blog.php?id=1483
comments.subject: Thanks...

comments.article: How about Hakim Nicks and his 3 TD's? I remember him his Senior year at UNC, and thought he was going to be a special player in the NFL.

sic gloria transit mundi

The mouse-over text for this was something I thought you'd appreciate:

http://asofterworld.com/index.php?id=594

It was a great honour to meet you in Sydney Mr. Martin. Only days later did I realise that I was a little starstruck and forgot to say how awesome your books are and how much pleasure I've had in reading them, especially the Ice and Fire series. Hope you have a great trip and keep up the excellent work.

-BS
comments.subject: Sydney Galaxy Bookstore Signing

comments.article: Try atdhe.net, Mr. Martin.
